member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.ActiveRecipe.PcbIndividualId
member.summary: PCB individual ID is the Identifier for PCB individual, which is assigned by the station software to each incoming PCB. The identifier starts with 1 on each station and is increased for each individual. This is ensured by persisting the current identifier value. When the value range of integer is reached, the count starts with 1 again. The same PCB Individual will be assigned with a new identifier on subsequent stations!

member.summary: Division of the feeder, where the component is setup up (component based). Range: 1-3

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.ComponentLocation.Level
member.summary: Level within a carrier, where the component is set up (component based). This property is required for MTC/WPW/TrayStack, else 0

member.summary: Tower number of a MTC/WPW, else 0 (component based).

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.ComponentLocation.StationTrack
member.summary:
This is the number of the track on the station based on the track ruler for this component location. For Feeders with more divisions, the track to be scanned to identify the component location is not the track of the feeder.
This property is only set in events send by the application. This property can not be set from outside.

member.name: T:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.ComponentLocationState
member.summary: Description of the state for a dedicated component location at the machine

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.ComponentLocationState.MachineControllerState
member.summary:
MCState of this division.
Value Description
0 Initial value.
1 State is o.k.
2 Machine Controller has deactivated this track.
4 There is a hardware error on this track.
8 The foil has been torn at the feeder.
16 The feeder has been removed.
32 Deactivation by SetupControl. Supported since 701 station software!
64
Deactivation since splice sensor is required by target setup but missing. Supported since 701 station software!
128
Deactivation since target setup does not match real setup (e.g. feeder type mismatch). Supported since 701 station software!
256 Locked by SetupControl. Supported since 701 station software!
512
Deactivation since component location cannot be reached by place head (e.g. on X4i). Supported since 701 station software!
1024
Deactivation since reel has been removed from X-feeder on station. I.e. by explicit user action on X-feeder. Supported since 701 station software!
2048 Deactivated because of torn foil on other feeder. Supported since 701 station software!
4096 Only SSI: Deactivated because the actual unique id of the wafer does not match the value provided by Setup Center
8192 Only SSI: The tape of the SIPLACE AutoRefillFeeder 8mm X was unloaded
16384 Only SSI: The tape duct of the SIPLACE AutoRefillFeeder 8mm X is empty

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.ComponentLocationState.ValidationStatus
member.summary:
ValidationStatus of this division.
Value Description
0 None.
1 Ignore
2 OK.
3 Unchecked.
4 Warning.
5 Fail.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.ComponentLocationState.FillingLevelState
member.summary:
Gets or sets the state of the filling level. Null means not supported by this Setup Center Version (lower than 9.2).
Value Description
0 Unknown
1 Ok
2 Low
3 Empty
member.value: The state of the filling level.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.ComponentLocationState.IsCliThresholdActive
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the cli threshold is active or inactive. If Setup Center sends new packaging data to the station the threshold activation is reset. To let external systems like Line Monitor know about the reset threshold activation this information is cached in the device cache and forwarded via the Setup Center Interface
member.value: true if cli threshold is active; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.ComponentLocationState.RescanIsRequired
member.summary: Indicates that the packaging unit has to be rescanned. This is true if the defined rescan time after refill operation is reached. The remaining time for rescan is provided in RescanRemainingTime property.
member.remarks: This is only filled for Setup Center 9.5 or higher

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.ComponentLocationState.RescanRemainingTime
member.summary: If the force rescan option is enabled Setup Center then the RescanRemainingTime indicates the remaining time for rescanning the packaging unit before it is locked.
member.remarks: This is only filled for Setup Center 9.5 or higher

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.ComponentLocationState.ShiftChangeIsRequired
member.summary: Indicates that the packaging unit has to be scanned for Shift Change. This is true if the defined Shift Change stop threshold is reached. The remaining time for Shift Change is provided in property.
member.remarks: This is only filled for Setup Center 9.9 or higher

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.ComponentLocationState.ShiftChangeRemainingTime
member.summary: If the force Forced Shift Change option is enabled Setup Center then the indicates the remaining time for Shift Change scan for the packaging unit before it is locked.
member.remarks: This is only filled for Setup Center 9.9 or higher

member.name: M:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.ComponentLocationState.ToString
member.summary: Returns a that represents this instance.

member.summary:
The reason why this method was called. Possible value are:
Value Description
0 Unknown: The reason is unknown
1 Set: The MES is called for a set operation
2 Refill: The MES is called for a refill operation.
3 FeederPlaced: The MES is called for a placed feeder.
4 AnnounceTable: The MES is called because a table is announced online at a station location.
5 OfflineInsertTable: The MES is called because a table was scanned during opening an offline verification.
6 SetupControlDataRequest: The MES is called because a station requested new data.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.MaterialReuseResponseData.ReuseStatus
member.summary:
Material Reuse Status to determine what to do with the corresponding PU of a particialr Feeder division.
Value Description
0 Do nothing: No action required for his specific
1 Required: Do not Tear down packaging unit, park the Feeder
2 NotRequired: Tear down packaging Unit, put Material in storage.
3 Recalculate: Material reuse status has to be recalculated.
4 Constant: The material belongs to a constant table or constant setup.
-1 Unknown: Material reuse status is unknown.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.TableLocationMoveOut.IsReadyToMoveOut
member.summary: Indicates if a changeover table is ready to be moved out of the station location.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.TableLocationMoveOut.ErrorCode
member.summary:
Specifies the error code if a changeover cannot be moved out
Value Description
0 Done: The operation was successfully performed.
1 NoTableDevice: Could not perform the operation because no table found.
2 ProtectiveCoverOpen: Could not perform the operation because the machine cover is open.
3 TableAlreadyRemoved: Could not perform the operation because a changeover table is already removed from this position.
4 TableAlreadyInserted: Could not perform the operation because a changeover table is already inserted on this position.
5 TableImmovable: The table cannot be moved because it is fixed assembled.
6 CompressedAirNotOk: Could not perform the operation because the air compression was not OK.
7 MovementError: Could not perform the operation because the machine had a movement error.
8 MachineStartFailed: Could not perform the operation because the start of machine failed.

member.name: T:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.ExternalControlResult
member.summary: There will be an option in the SetupCenter business logic to make external calls to an interface for every verification step against a component location. This object includes the result of the external calls, in which the validation of the Packaging unit data will be done. With that, the successful operation is indicated or a operational error with some messages indicating the cause for the incorrect operation.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.ExternalControlResult.ResultState
member.summary:
The result status of the returned ExternalControlResult.
Value Description
0
Unknown: The result of the packaging unit data is unknown
1
OK: The Packaging unit data is processed successfully
A internal lock described as LockInfo (Source=9, Reason=28) will be cleared from the packaging unit data when ResultState = 2 is returned.
2
NotOk: The verification status of the packaging unit data should be cleared.
A internal lock described as LockInfo (Source=9, Reason=28) will be added to the packaging unit data when ResultState = 2 is returned.

member.summary: This is the line name of this line in SIPLACE Pro.

member.summary: Gets or sets the machines.

member.summary: The list of printers in this line.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.LineConfiguration.IsFeederSubstitutionAllowed
member.summary: Indicates if feeder substitution between "8mm X" and "2 x 8mm X" is enabled. The feeder types 8 mm X and 2x8mm X or 8 mm E and 2x8mm E can be substituted for one another, without changing the setup in SIPLACE Pro. The machine is able to start the pickup immediately after a feeder type changeover.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.LineConfiguration.IsRandomFeederSetupForOfflineVerificationAllowed
member.summary: Enables the Random Setup setting, as defined in the SIPLACE Pro setup, in Setup Center(at line level). The table-wise random setup function is now permitted for offline verification, irrespective of the downloaded SIPLACE Pro setup. If this option is disabled, the setup for this line must be configured for the exact track in the pre-setup area, irrespective of the setup setting in SIPLACE Pro.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.LineConfiguration.IsAutomaticReorderActivated
member.summary: If the SIPLACE station reports a low filling level for materials, the SIPLACE Setup Center supports automatic reordering of this material. SIPLACE Setup Center collects these SIPLACE station messages, and, after a set time interval, forwards them to the configured material management system (e.g.the SIPLACE Material Manager) for further processing.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.LineConfiguration.IsAutomaticReorderOnlyOnConstantTablesActivated
member.summary: The automatic reorder of material in case offilling level is low should only be applied to material that is set up on a constant table.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.LineConfiguration.MatrixTrayChangerManagementOption
member.summary: Specifies the Matrix Tray Changer and Multiple JEDEC Tray Feeder verification mode. The following values are available: 0: Standard The Matrix Tray Changer(MTC) and the Multiple JEDEC Tray Feeder are only integrated into the verification in the case of online setup verification. 1: TableManagement The Matrix Tray Changer (MTC) and the Multiple JEDEC Tray Feeder are integrated into the verification in the case of offline and online setup verification. 2: CassetteManagement The Matrix Tray Changer (MTC) and the Multiple JEDEC Tray Feeder are integrated into the verification in the case of offline and online setup verification.However, management of verified components is on a cassette basis.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.LineConfiguration.WafflePackChangerManagementOption
member.summary:
Waffle Pack Changer verification mode(not relevant for SX1 and SX2). The following values are available:
0: Standard The Waffle Pack Changer(WPC) is only integrated into the verification in the case of online setup verification. 1: TableManagement The Waffle Pack Changer (WPC) is integrated into the verification in the case of offline setup verification.

member.name: T:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.LockInfo
member.summary: Information about the lock state

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.LockInfo.Source
member.summary:
The source of the material quantity correction
Value Description
0 Unknown: The origin of an operation is not known.
1 A manual interaction within Setup Center GUI released the operation.
2 A interaction with a Setup Center scanner released the operation.
3 The station itself released the operation.
4 Setup Center Interface released the operation.
5 Operation released by placing/announcing/moving a table.
6 Operation released by removing a table.
7 Operation released by placing a feeder.
8 Operation released by removing a feeder.
9 Operation released by Setup Center internal operation.
10 The docking station itself released the operation.
11 During an upgrade installation the data was modified.
12 The action was triggered by placing a cassette in matrix tray changer or matrix tray feeder.
13 The action was triggered by removing a cassette from matrix tray changer or matrix tray feeder.
14 The action was triggered by placing a cartridge on the bulk case X-Feeder.
15 The action was triggered by removing the cartridge from the bulk case X-Feeder.
16 The action was triggered by placing tray carriers on the Tray Unit.
17 The action was triggered by removing tray carriers from the Tray Unit.
18 The action was triggered by moving tray carriers inside the Tray Unit.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.LockInfo.Reason
member.summary:
The reason for this lock entry
Value Description
0 Not Specified: Reason is not specified or is unknown.
1 Component mismatch.
1 Component mismatch.
2 Msd level floor time expired.
3 Splice chain length exceeded.
4 Result of an operation with the packaging unit editor.
5
Result of a splice monitor operation: Setup Center recognized, that a splice must have still taken place, but the splice monitor didnt detect one until now.
6 The feeder informs about a foil torn.
7 An existing packaging unit is replaced by another.
8 The station requests data.
9 Mismatch of a splice chain between station and Setup Center.
10 A packaging unit was torn down on a feeder, that does not belong to the setup.
11 New setup active on station.
12 A table is moved to another setup and the data is filtered.
13 Packaging unit belongs to another Setup Center and must be torn down.
14 Packaging unit is moved from one position to another.
15
Result of an operation of the splice monitor: This case happens, if the splice sensor detects a splice although there was no physical splice.
16
Result of an operation of splice monitor: This case happens, if there is only one packaging unit on the track at the station, but there is set a greyzone.
17 The feeder type of an x-adapter has changed.
18 Packaging unit (piece) is expired
19 Setup Change in SC.
20
Due to an error the data have been upgrade, for instance during an upgrade installation of Setup Center.
21 The component is not used in the current partial setup.
22 The component's place flag in SIPLACE Pro is off.
23 The component's skip flag in SIPLACE Pro is enabled.
24 The component's Validate flag in SIPLACE Pro is off.
25 The packaging unit(s) was deleted by the verification history maintenance.
26 The packaging unit(s) was deleted by the packaging unit maintenance.
27 The reel was removed from the feeder.
28 The reel was locked by external MES system.
29 The track was deactivated.
30 The reel was locked due to incorrect refill.
31 The reel was locked due to brightness class mismatch.
32 The verification state of the division is not secure. Introduced in Setup Center 9.0.
33 The verification unique id on the Siplace Wafer System does not match the value provided by Setup Center. Introduced in Setup Center 9.0.
34 Msd level floor time about to expire. Introduced in Setup Center 9.0.
35 The tape duct of the SIPLACE AutoRefillFeeder 8mm X is empty. Introduced in Setup Center 9.5.
36 Indicates that the specified time for forced rescan has expired. Introduced in Setup Center 9.5.

member.name: T:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.PrinterDeviceState
member.summary: PrinterDeviceState class. Contains state details of a printer device.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.PrinterDeviceState.DeviceState
member.summary: The device state has the following values and meaning: Unknown = -1 Recovery = 0 Setup = 1 Ready = 2 Maintenance = 3 Waiting = 4 Starved = 5 Blocked = 6 Paused = 7 Running = 8 Error = 10 Init = 11 If the printer reports error device state and the error number is 2239 or 2378 then all consumables with the filling level 0 are empty. Cleaner Solvent, Cleaner Paper, Paste Level and Proflow Level will send an error code 2239 when they are totally empty. Stinger will send an error code of 2378 when it's empty. If the printer reports device state Setup(1), Ready(2) or Running(8) the filling level state of consumables can be reset to not empty.

member.summary: The list of divisions. This list is empty in all events where the component location is used. It is only filled in FeederPlaced and InstantFeederPlaced events. The property is only filled for Setup Center Versions 6.3 and higher and Station Software Version 707.1 and higher.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.FeederLocation.TargetTrack

member.name: T:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.MaterialMoveData
member.summary: MaterialMoveData contains all information for one MaterialMoved event element.

member.name: F:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.MaterialMoveData.PackagingUnitLocation
member.summary:
The moved packaging unit and the associated component location.
The location will be set whenever it is possible. For all move in operations like set, refill or insert, the location is known always and will be provided. For normal move out operations the location is set to the location where the material has been removed. There are some cases where the location is not known for some move out operations. This is when a move in operation is using material which is located in another location. Then the location is not set, because it is unknown. This might happen, when the location tracking is missing a complete chain of move triggers.

member.name: F:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.MaterialMoveData.Action
member.summary:
The type of material movement.
Value Description
1 Set packaging unit.
2 Refill packaging unit.
3 Tear down packaging unit.
7 Hardware is inserted in the station (Table, Feeder).
8
Hardware is removed from the station (table, feeder). The packaging units are NOT torn down or deleted. This action indicates, that the packaging units are still bound to the feeder.
9 Split one packaging unit into two.
10 Activate a track.

member.name: F:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.MaterialMoveData.Source
member.summary:
The source of an operation, e.g. PackagingUnitQuantityChanged event, detected within Setup Center.
Value Description
0 Unknown: The origin of an operation is not known.
1 A manual interaction within Setup Center GUI released the operation.
2 A interaction with a Setup Center scanner released the operation.
3 The station itself released the operation.
4 Setup Center Interface released the operation.
5 Operation released by placing a table.
6 Operation released by removing a table.
7 Operation released by placing a feeder.
8 Operation released by removing a feeder.
9 Operation released by Setup Center internal operation.
10 The docking station itself released the operation.
11 During an upgrade installation the data was modified.
12 The action was triggered by placing a cassette in matrix tray changer or matrix tray feeder.
13 The action was triggered by removing a cassette from matrix tray changer or matrix tray feeder.
14 The action was triggered by placing a cartridge on the bulk case X-Feeder.
15 The action was triggered by removing the cartridge from the bulk case X-Feeder.
16 The action was triggered by placing tray carriers on the Tray Unit.
17 The action was triggered by removing tray carriers from the Tray Unit.
18 The action was triggered by moving tray carriers inside the Tray Unit.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.PackagingUnit.MsdLevel
member.summary:
JEDEC Moisture Sensitivity Level 1-6.
Value Description
1 Level 1: Unlimited - The component can be assembled unlimited (max. 30C / 85% RH)
2
Level 2: 1 year - The component can be assembled 1 year after the opening date of the packaging unit at (max. 30C / 85% RH)
3
Level 2A: 4 weeks - The component can be assembled 4 weeks after the opening date of the packaging unit at (max. 30C / 85% RH)
4
Level 3: 168 hours - The component can be assembled 168 hours after the opening date of the packaging unit at (max. 30C / 85% RH)
5
Level 4: 72 hours - The component can be assembled 72 hours after the opening date of the packaging unit at (max. 30C / 85% RH)
6
Level 5: 48 hours - The component can be assembled 48 hours after the opening date of the packaging unit at (max. 30C / 85% RH)
7
Level 5A: 24 hours - The component can be assembled 24 hours after the opening date of the packaging unit at (max. 30C / 85% RH)
8
Level 6: Time on Label - The time is stored on an additional label on the reel. The component can be assembled for that time period defined on the label after the opening date of the packaging unit at (max. 30C / 85% RH)
Setup Center 8.1 and higher supports MSD level 6. However due to difficulties to read the time on the label Setup Center will use only one configurable allowed open time for all MSD 6 level reels. The default value is 4 hours. This can be changed in the Setup Center domain configuration dialog. The value is also stored along with other domain settings in OIB plant layout to allow other applications to read it. The setting key is SetupCenter.AllowedOpenTimeForMsdLevel6.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.PackagingUnit.SplicedPackagingUnit
member.summary: Chain of packaging units

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.PackagingUnit.MsdOpenDate
member.summary:
MSD open date (the Date is transferred as UTC times).
In case the MsdOpenDate is set to 1.1.1900 UTC or before that time, the packaging unit's MSD time is not increased. This state is also called 'closed'.
In case a packaging unit has an MSD Level which is not equal to 1 (Level 1: Unlimited), the MsdOpenDate Date will be set to the current timestamp. This state is then called 'opened'.
In case you want to calculate when the packaging unit is to be considered due (MSD due date) the formula is as following:
MSD Due Date Description
Unlimited In case MSDLevel is 1 (Unlimited)
MsdOpenDate + Duration of MSDLevel (see documentation) In case MSDLevel is NOT 1

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.PackagingUnit.LockInfos
member.summary: LockInfos contains the information about the locks associated with this packaging unit. The packaging has no elements, if the packaging unit has no locks. This property can not directly be set, only via the Functions Lock and UnLock. Any incoming property will be ignored.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.PackagingUnit.LastProductionDate
member.summary:
This is the time stamp from the last action performed by Setup Center triggered by a production event by the SIPLACE Machine.
The value is to 1753.01.01 00:00:00 Universal time, if it was never involved in production. This data is only set, when the events are send out of Setup Center. This property can not be set via the interface. This value is only set for Setup Center Version 3.3. and above

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.PackagingUnit.ConsumptionDate
member.summary:
This is the time stamp from the consuming operation performed by Setup Center.
A packaging unit is not necessarily consumed, when the filling level is set to 0. The system maintain a grey zone for the traceability data. This means that the packing units are kept alive, even when the filling level is set to zero. The packaging units are set to consumed, when this grey zone is ended. The value is to 9999.12.31 23:59:59 Universal time, if it is not consumed. This data is only set, when the events are send out of Setup Center. This property can not be set via the interface. This value is only set for Setup Center Version 3.3. and above

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.PackagingUnit.BatchPackagingUnit
member.summary:
This field specify the parent packaging unit for the ICL (identical component lot) Packaging Units. The Packaging Unit can be queried the quantity as well as other properties for the whole batch. Note: in case of OfflineSetup this property could be null.
This data is only set, when the events are send out of Setup Center. This property can not be set via the interface. This value is only set for Setup Center Version 3.3. and above
Range: 0 - 256 signs

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.PackagingUnit.GreyZone
member.summary: This specifies the grey zone between 2 packaging units. A grey zone is a zone where the SIPLACE system can not determine where the switch between 2 packaging units has been taken place. Therefore the system tracks both packaging units. The quality of the GreyZone is driven by the process the customer is operating and if the feeder are using optional splice sensor detectors.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.PackagingUnit.AdditionalPartInformation
member.summary:
AdditionalPartInformation is a property which is encoded into the MAT Label definition. This information will be read by SetupCenter from the MAT-Labels and stored in the SetupCenter Database. Please see SetupCenter documentation how the MAT Labels are handled.
This information is only available for OIB services 2.4 and higher AND SIPLACE SetupCenter 4.0 and higher. All other software versions will ignore this property.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.PackagingUnit.Serial
member.summary:
Serial is a property which is encoded into the MAT Label definition. This information will be read by SetupCenter from the MAT-Labels and stored in the SetupCenter Database. Please see SetupCenter documentation how the MAT Labels are handled.
This information is only available for OIB services 2.4 and higher AND SIPLACE SetupCenter 4.0 and higher. All other software versions will ignore this property.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.PackagingUnit.RoHS
member.summary:
RoHS is a property which is encoded into the MAT Label definition. This information will be read by SetupCenter from the MAT-Labels and stored in the SetupCenter Database. Please see SetupCenter documentation how the MAT Labels are handled. RoHS is a official EU guideline for the usage of substances (Restriction of hazardous substances)
Value Description
0 Undefined RoHS status for this material
1 This is a RoHS compliant material
2 This is not a RoHS compliant material
This information is only available for OIB services 2.4 and higher AND SIPLACE SetupCenter 4.0 and higher. All other software versions will ignore this property.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.PackagingUnit.BrightnessClass
member.summary:
BrightnessClass is a property which defined an optional brightness class for this material. The brightness class can be used during material verification even when the part number information does not differ.
This information is only available for OIB services 2.4 and higher AND SIPLACE SetupCenter 4.0 and higher. All other software versions will ignore this property.

member.summary:
When SetupCenter is operating with the User Management for the scanners the scanned operator sting will be provided for all action performed with the scanner. There are actions for this event, where this information will not be provided like feeder movements, because it is performed without operator context.
This feature is officially only available for SetupCenter 4.2 and higher and OIB 2.5 and higher. This property is only set in the external setup control interface. This property is only for informational purposes and will not be accepted from the external system.

This property is only set in the external setup control interface and beginning with SetupCenter 9.2 and higher in the normal OIB interfaces.

member.name: T:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.PackagingUnitQuantityData
member.summary:
PackagingUnitQuantityData contains all information for one PackagingUnitQuantity-Changed event element. The SIPLACE machines are sending for each board a PackagingUnitQuantityChanged event, whenever a machine is releasing a board. This generate a lot of traffic in the network and the central OIB WS-Eventing. The actual Setup Center Adapter has implemented a caching of the PackagingUnitQuantityChanged events with the Action = 3 and the StationQuantityChangeReason=2. These events will be cached and the QuanityCorrection will be accumulated until a send trigger is initiated. Triggers are
Any other PackagingUnitQuantityChanged event..
Any Action effecting the cached component location. For example. A feeder is removed, then all cached events correlated to that feeder will be send. Setup Changes
Restart of the adapter itself
Pre-configured period of time, until the first occurrence from an event on one component location. Default period is 60 minutes.
Setup Changes
Configuration By default the installation is configured to cache these events. It can be adjusted in the oib section under configuration->oib in the Asm.As.OIB.SIPLACESetupCenter.V30.Host.exe.config files in the installation directory. Changing the value from setupCenterUseProductionEventCache to false will disable the cache functions. Changing the value setupCenterUseProductionEventCacheTimeSpan will change the time in minutes.

member.summary: PackagingUnit affected by this correction.

member.summary: The delta value, between the latest and the actual quantity. Negative value means a component consumption. The value is given for each quantity change reason The value 99999999 indicates a undefined value for that property.

member.summary: Timestamp, when the quantity correction operation occurred

member.name: F:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.PackagingUnitQuantityData.Source
member.summary:
The source of the material quantity correction
Value Description
0 Unknown: The origin of an operation is not known.
1 A manual interaction within Setup Center GUI released the operation.
2 A interaction with a Setup Center scanner released the operation.
3 The station itself released the operation.
4 Setup Center Interface released the operation.
5 Operation released by placing/announcing/moving a table.
6 Operation released by removing a table.
7 Operation released by placing a feeder.
8 Operation released by removing a feeder.
9 Operation released by Setup Center internal operation.
10 The docking station itself released the operation.
11 During an upgrade installation the data was modified.
12 The action was triggered by placing a cassette in matrix tray changer or matrix tray feeder.
13 The action was triggered by removing a cassette from matrix tray changer or matrix tray feeder.
14 The action was triggered by placing a cartridge on the bulk case X-Feeder.
15 The action was triggered by removing the cartridge from the bulk case X-Feeder.
16 The action was triggered by placing tray carriers on the Tray Unit.
17 The action was triggered by removing tray carriers from the Tray Unit.
18 The action was triggered by moving tray carriers inside the Tray Unit.

item.description: Unknown: Packaging unit quantity changed due to a unknown reason.
ManualAdjustment: Packaging unit quantity changed due to a manual adjustment.
SpliceDetection: Packaging unit quantity changed due to a detected splice.
Production: Packaging unit quantity changed due to consumed components.
Refill: Packaging unit quantity changed due to refill with a new packaging unit.
Set: Packaging unit quantity changed due to setting of new packaging assignment after setup changeover / verification.
Clear: Packaging unit quantity changed due to a cleared packaging unit.
ErrorUpdate: Packaging unit quantity changed notification triggered by error occurred on station.
EquipmentRemovalUpdate: Packaging unit quantity changed notification triggered by removal of feeder / table on station.
SetupChangeOver: Packaging unit quantity changed notification triggered by setup change over on station.
AdjustedBySetupCenter: Packaging unit quantity changed due to adjustment from Setup Center.
GreyZoneEnd: Packaging unit quantity information changed due to end of gray zone.
SetUpdate: Packaging unit quantity notification triggered by setting of new packaging assignment.
ClearUpdate: Packaging unit quantity notification triggered by clearing packaging assignment.
ManualAdjustment: Packaging unit quantity changed due to manual adjustment.
QuantityCorrectionOnSplicedPackagingUnit: Packaging unit on reel reports its quantity correction after splice event.
SpliceMonitor: Splice monitor corrects the quantity values after the operator has been answered.
QuantityCorrectionOnEquipmentRemoval: Quantity correction after equipment removal in case of negative quantity. (Example: equipment removal, clear update, clear)

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.TableLocation.TableState
member.summary:
TableState assigns, if the table is online or offline. If it is online, the machine property has to be set, else docking station has to be set. Therefore the not required property has to be set to null.
Value Description
0 Unknown: The table state is not known.
1 Online: The table is located at the machine.
2 Offline: The table is located at the x docking station.
3
None: The table state is unknown, if it's not online and offline. E.g. a component location may be unknown, if an associated packaging unit is torn down..

member.summary: Station location (feeder based). Range: 1-4

member.summary: Changeover table identification.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.TableLocation.Device
member.summary:
Device is the table sub-location. There are machines like the SIPLACE SX, where the several tables types can be placed into one location. To define the complete location the device defines which bay inside a location is used.
This device can have a value of either 1 or 2. For the machines before the SIPLACE SX this will always set to 1.
This will be set for the events coming from Setup Center. This values is optional when you call functions like Set(), Teardown() or others, because the location is defining the logical location completely.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Faults.SiplaceSetupCenterFault.ErrorCode
member.summary:
The error to be used, when an system error or business error occurred.
Value Error Description
100000 This is a generic system error
100001
The application for the OIB adapter is not running. Especially the Setup Center application might not run, when the adapter is accessing the application functionality. Please restart the application.
100003
The application for the OIB has an internal error. Especially the Setup Center application might have a malfunction through to not accessible SQL Server. Please check functionality from SetupCenter application.
100100
There is no license for OIB available. Please check your licenses.
200000 This is a generic business error

member.summary: This property will be filled out, if a table is placed online or offline. In case of offline, the event means only physical placement of the table. If table management is activated, processing is not possible until this table is announced. In case of offline, the table id is only set, if the table is already announced.

member.summary: This property will be filled out, whenever a feeder was placed to the line or docking station. This event will be sent immediately and without any verification context

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Message.SetupCenterEventDataRequest.NewRecipeActiveReport
member.summary: Method will be called by SetupCenter, if there is a new recipe active on a station of the line. This method will be only executed, if the machine reports back a new active recipe to Setup Center. The event will be fired independently for each conveyor lane and for each processing area. If the machine consists of 2 conveyor lanes and 2 processing areas then 4 events will be fired after recipe change (2 events for conveyor lane 1 and 2 events for conveyor lane 2) irrespective of whether both conveyor lanes contain the same recipe or not. This event is currently only supported by SIRIO Version >= 709

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Message.SetupCenterEventDataRequest.PrinterConsumablesUpdatedReport
member.summary: This property will be filled out, whenever fill level changes of the specified printer consumables occur.

member.summary: The tool verified event will be fired by the printer if a tool is verified by the operator.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Message.SetupCenterEventDataRequest.PrinterCoverClosedReport

member.summary: The printer capability changed event will be fired by the printer after startup and after changes

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Message.SetupCenterEventDataRequest.ConfigurationChangedReport
member.summary:
Gets or sets the configuration changed report. The configuration class will contain the following settings:
OnlineVerificationConfiguration: The general settings for online verification of the Setup Center instance like IsSpliceMonitorActive, MissingSpliceThresholdPercent, MissingSpliceThresholdNumberOfItems.
LineConfigurations: For each line the settings for the line like IsFeederSubstitutionAllowed, IsAutomaticReorderActivated, IsRandomFeederSetupForOfflineVerificationAllowed etc. MachineConfigurations: For each station in the line the machine settings like MachineId, MachineName, MachineType, IsMsdVerificationEnabled and ComponentLevelIndicatorThresholds. PrinterConfigurations: For each printer in the line the printer settings like MachineId, PrinterPath, PrinterType.
DockingStationConfiguration: Contains the configuration for docking stations DockingStations: For each configured docking station contains the DockingStationId.

member.name: F:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Message.SetupCenterEventDataRequest.FactoryLocation
member.summary: Name of the location inside the factory. This based on the path name defined in the configuration manager service. The naming convention is as following: Assigned Factory Layout Element Path: "Enterprise:Sample Site:Central Area:ProductionLine_1:Siplace Pro Line 1" (can be seen in OIB Factory Explorer GUI) This FactoryLocation Property: "Sample Site.Central Area.ProductionLine_1.Siplace Pro Line 1" This means that the Enterprise part of the path is stripped off and the ':'s are replaced by '.'s.

member.name: F:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Message.SetupCenterEventDataRequest.TimeStamp
member.summary: Date and time in UTC when the message was send by the adapter.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Message.SetupCenterEventDataRequest.NewSetupControlDataRequestedReport
member.summary: Event is fired by Setup Center when the station requests new setup control data (on NewSetupActive and when the station (re-)connects). It informs the MES that the station got new control data.

member.summary: The method will be called by Setup Center if the component level indicator threshold is changed. This event is only supported for SIRIO stations.
member.value: The component level indicator threshold changed report.

member.name: T:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Service.IDekPrinterExternalControl
member.summary:
Interface for MES applications which want to do interlocking for Printer.
The printer will request for verifiable items (e.g. materials and tools) and let the operator chose what items need to be verified.
Whenever the operator scans an item the printer sends a request to the MES via this interface to verify the item.
Only if the MES allows the usage of this item, the status of the item at the printer will become "verified" and thus this item can be used. If not, the item will remain unverified and the printer cannot continue.
The printer can only continue if all specified items are successfully verified by the MES system.

member.name: M:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Service.IDekPrinterExternalControl.Ping(Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.PingRequest)
member.summary: The ping function performs a check, if the connection to the underlying system components is alive or not

member.name: M:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Service.IDekPrinterExternalControl.VerifyPrinterTool(Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.VerifyPrinterToolRequest)
member.summary: Called in case a tool is verified by the operator on the printer. The MES has to decide if the tool can be used by the printer. In case it should not be used, MES will set the verification status to Error (=2) and thereby prevent usage of the tool. The error message is displayed on the printer. In case of status warning is returned, the warning message is displayed on the printer but the tool can be used.

member.name: M:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Service.IDekPrinterExternalControl.VerifyPrinterMaterial(Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.VerifyPrinterMaterialRequest)
member.summary: Called in case a material is verified by the operator on the printer. The MES has to decide if the material can be used by the printer. In case it should not be used, MES will set the verification status to Error (=2) and thereby prevent usage of the material. The error message is displayed on the printer. In case of status warning is returned, the warning message is displayed on the printer but the material can be used.

member.summary: The station will call the new method to request the nozzle status from Setup Center. Setup Center will forward the request to the MES system and hand over the results to the station. If the MES system is not reachable then the nozzle status will be set to NOK and the nozzle cannot be used. After correcting potential connection problems with MES the nozzle status request has to be re-initiated by the operator.

member.name: T:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Service.ISiplaceFeederExternalControl
member.summary:
Setup Center calls the Feeder External Control Service in the following cases:
1. Online Area: If the feeder is placed in the machine on a changeover table If table management is active the feeder is checked only if a changeover table has already been registered for the location where the feeder is placed. A changeover table with feeders is registered for a location in the machine (if the changeover table management is active).
2. Offline Area (Pre-Setup Area): If the feeder is placed on a docking station or feeder rack.
3. The offline setup verification is started scanning the setup report, docking station ID and changeover table ID.
Setup Center composes a list of the feeder IDs. The list is sent to the External Feeder Control Service for approval. The service checks the feeder IDs and reports a status Feeder is OK or Feeder is not OK and a reason why the feeder should not be used. Rejected feeders which are placed in online area are locked on the machine (component pickup not possible). The error message is displayed on the station GUI. The feeder LED will only be set to red color if the feeder is used in the recipe. Otherwise the feeder LED is off. Rejected feeders which are placed in pre-setup area show locked in their display if present and the LED is turned to red color. The feeder status is also updated in the Setup Center GUI to Error (red color).
Subsequent Setup Center operations for verifying packaging units with a scanner (setting, refilling packaging unit and activation of tracks) checks the feeder status set by the External Control Service and deny verification if the feeder was locked. A corresponding message is shown on the display of the scanner.

member.name: M:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Service.ISiplaceFeederExternalControl.Ping(Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.PingRequest)
member.summary: The ping function performs a check, if the connection to the underlying system components is alive or not

member.name: M:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Service.ISiplaceFeederExternalControl.GetFeederMaintenanceStatus(Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.GetFeederMaintenanceStatusRequest)
member.summary:
The GetFeederMaintenanceStatus method has to be implemented by the Feeder External Control service in order to indicate whether the specified feeders should be locked. This will force the operator to bring the feeders in maintenance.
The GetFeederMaintenanceStatusRequest contains a list of feeder locations with the corresponding feeder ID and data.
The GetFeederMaintenanceStatusResponse for each feeder location (FeederId, FeederType, Track, etc.) should contain the maintenance status (ResultState, Reason) for each feeder in the request list.
The Reason attribute will contain the maintenance description in case that the ResultState indicates not OK.
The text in Reason attribute will be displayed on the Setup Center and Station GUI.

member.name: T:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Service.ISiplaceSetupCenterExternalControl
member.summary:
Note: The interface is NOT obsolete, but it should not be referenced from the ASM.AS.OIB.SIPLACESetupCenter.Contracts.dll.
Please use the generated definitions in proxySetupCenter.cs instead.
This is the service interface for the integration of Setup Center functionality.
The ISiplaceSetupCenterExternalControl enables MES systems to take just in time control of the verification process in Setup Center.
The ISiplaceSetupCenterExternalControl has to be registered in OIB using SIPLACE Line Control Adapter. The Line Control Adapter will set the proper attributes for the production line after first download of a recipe. The MES service has to be configured for the designated production line or in higher hierarchy in the plant layout path.
It is also possible to configure a different MES service per production line.
The interface consists of the following methods:
GetNewPackagingUnitData will be called by Setup Center if the scanned unique ID is not in Setup Center database. The MES system will get the scanned barcode and return the packaging unit data for the scanned unique ID.
GetPackagingUnitControlStatus will be called if the packaging unit is sent to the station or scanned in offline setup preparation area. This happens if a packaging unit is set or refilled, if a change over table is registered or Setup Center connects to the station (after restart or reconnect). This method is also called after calling the GetNewPackagingUnitData method. This method is the first verification action in the verification process. Setup Center will first call this method to get the new data and status of the packaging unit from MES. Then Setup Center will continue verifying the component name, expiry date, MSD level etc. using the data returned by the MES system.
It is not allowed to call Setup Center using the ISiplaceSetupCenter interface in the call of the above methods. This would cause a deadlock, because the methods are called from Setup Center using a synchronization context.
The API will have an extended semantics for SetupCenter Version 5.1 and above. These changes are described in the following table.
Description Notes
Accept a packaging unit chain for the scanned packaging unit.
For the operations performed with the scanner like set and refill the scanned packaging unit does not exists in SetupCenter then SetupCenter will call MES system to get the data for scanned packaging unit. In this case SetupCenter should be able to process a packaging unit chain if it is returned from MES instead of a single packaging unit.
The MES cannot return another packaging unit for the scanned packaging unit
The scanned packaging unit is the reel which the operator scans and therefore has to be returned as the reel from MES system.This rule applies to all operations performed in SetupCenter after calling MES system.
MES can return a chain of packaging units
The MES can return a chain of packaging units in the call for the packaging units which will for the packaging units moved to the feeder location. If the chain in SetupCenter is different from the chain returned from MES system then SetupCenter will modify the chain according to the chain from MES. If the chain contains packaging units which are already part of another chain in SetupCenter then this chain will be split.
Unknown Packaging Units will be created on the fly Unknown Packaging Units will be created on the fly, when appearing in the chain.
Already mounted packaging units will be kept untouched
If a modified chain contains packaging units, which are already mounted elsewhere, then SetupCenter will reject the packaging unit chain from MES. This results in an error message on the Setup Center side and unmodified packaging unit data. No splitting of existing packaging unit chains or demounting of already mounted packaging units will be performed. In case of this error the chain sent to MES will not be modified and the packaging unit chain will get an external MES lock if no scan operation is in action.
Refill and Set operations by the operator will be handled differently
For example, when refilling PU A to C and MES will return the chain A,B and B is already mounted, then the Refill operation will not be performed. An error message is displayed on the scanner and on the SetupCenter GUI. Data has to be changed in MES and/or SetupCenter. Afterwards the Refill operation must be redone to resolve the conflict. This is also true for set operations by the operator.
Value data will be validated before the verification process. Any incorrect property value, like negative quantities, MSD, RoHS will be rejected.
Error messages resulting from the processing of the returned data from MES will displayed in the SetupCenter GUI
An internal MES lock should be set to the packaging units in that location in case of a validation error. This internal lock can only be removed, when the operator is triggering the verification (so a Set or Refill) operation again.
Greyzone values will be delivered to MES and must be provided by MES in the return values.
This implies that MES must maintain the Greyzone values to keep the traceability data correct. In SetupCenter there is a new configuration option which indicates if the MES system is master of the greyzone. If the option is set then the greyzone will be taken from MES and MES is responsible for the correctness of the greyzone.
Show the error message of MES locks if operator clicks on the division which already has a MES lock.
MES locks in the GUI will be displayed like any other lock. When clicking on it, it will display a detailed lock message to indicate to the operator that the root case is in the MES and modifications have to be performed in the MES to resolve the error condition.
SetupCenter has to show the connection status of the MES system on the GUI.
SetupCenter has to show the connection status of the MES system on the GUI. The icon will indicate if the MES system is working properly or if there are connection errors. In case of multiple MES systems the icon is in error state if at least one MES system cannot be reached from SetupCenter. The tool tip will display the connection status for each production line. In case of changes in connection status SetupCenter will detect the change only if an active operation is performed (scan, place feeder etc.). If no operation is performed the last known status will be shown.
The update behavior of MES data.
If a scan operation is performed then all data for a packaging unit from MES will be updated in SetupCenter. However if an implicit operation like feeder place, setup change etc. happens, SetupCenter will update the packaging unit data only if the following attributes are changed by the MES system: Quantity, MsdLevel, MsdLive, MsdOpenDate, ExpiryDate, RoHS, GreyZone.

member.name: M:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Service.ISiplaceSetupCenterExternalControl.GetPackagingUnitControlStatus(System.Collections.Generic.List{Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.PackagingUnitLocation})
member.summary:
Request the packaging Unit data from an external system (like MES System) during the verification process. This is enables the external system to control the data for the verification process. The PackagingUnitResult object describes the data returned from the external system.
When using this interface with SetupCenter Version 5.1 and higher it would be possible to split existing packaging unit chains by returning a reduced packaging unit chain back to SetupCenter.
member.returns: The list of result of the operation for these packaging units. The value in PackagingUnitResult indicates the values for the setup center packaging units. When packaging Unit data is returned as 2=NotOk, then a internal Lock will be attached to the PackagingUnitData with Source = 9 and Reason = 28 in the LockInfo data. This will be internally released in SetupCenter, when the external system is returning 1=Ok in this method call. This internal lock can not the changed explicit from the external system.

member.name: M:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Service.ISiplaceSetupCenterExternalControl.GetNewPackagingUnitData(System.Collections.Generic.List{Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.PackagingUnitLocation})
member.summary:
This method will be called by SetupCenter, when a bar code is scanned in unique id mode with an unique bar code fragment, if no packaging unit data is existing in the SetupCenter database. This is just in time data transfer and it must not be done in advance. The packaging unit data is containing all properties, which have been parsed from the bar code with all containing bar code fragment information found on the reel. The packaging unit data object is filled with all properties found during the scan operations based on the bar code configuration and scanned bar codes.
This is only available when using OIB 2.5 and higher and SetupCenter 4.2 and higher. If you call a previous version of this interface, you will get a communication exception telling you that the Action GetNewPackagingUnitData is not known. Please update the receiving interface to updated version from OIB SDK 2.5 or higher.
member.param: list of component locations where the scan happens and which data was scanned
member.returns: The list of result of the operation for these packaging units. The value in PackagingUnitResult indicates the values for the setup center packaging units.

member.name: M:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Service.ISiplaceSetupCenterExternalControl.GetPackagingUnitControlStatusExtended(Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.GetPackagingUnitControlStatusExtendedRequest)
member.summary:
Request the packaging Unit data from an external system (like MES System) during the verification process. This is enables the external system to control the data for the verification process. The PackagingUnitResult object describes the data returned from the external system.
When using this interface with SetupCenter Version 5.1 and higher it would be possible to split existing packaging unit chains by returning a reduced packaging unit chain back to SetupCenter.
member.param: The request object containing a list of packaging unit locations and a reason of why the method is called.
member.returns: The response object containing the list of result of the operation for these packaging units. The value in PackagingUnitResult indicates the values for the setup center packaging units. When packaging Unit data is returned as 2=NotOk, then a internal Lock will be attached to the PackagingUnitData with Source = 9 and Reason = 28 in the LockInfo data. This will be internally released in SetupCenter, when the external system is returning 1=Ok in this method call. This internal lock can not the changed explicit from the external system.
member.remarks: This method will only be called from SetupCenter 9.4 and higher.

member.summary: This is the service interface for the integration of Setup Center functionality.

member.name: M:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Service.ISiplaceSetupCenter.IsConnected
member.summary: Checks if the Adapter is connected to the Setup Center Application and if the SC Application is connected to the Database
member.returns: true, if all system components are connected false, if any component is not operational.

member.name: M:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Service.ISiplaceSetupCenter.Set(System.Collections.Generic.List{Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.PackagingUnitLocation})
member.summary: Put PackagingUnit(s) in online verification. A mixed mode between Unique ID mode and ICL mode within one setup is invalid. Throws an exception in case one or more packaging units could not be set.

member.name: M:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Service.ISiplaceSetupCenter.Refill(System.Collections.Generic.List{Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.PackagingUnitLocation})
member.summary: Refill PackagingUnit(s) in on line verification. Throws an exception in case one or more packaging units could not be refilled.
member.param: PackagingUnit(s) to refill (ArrayList value type: PackagingUnitLocation).

member.name: M:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Service.ISiplaceSetupCenter.TearDown(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.ComponentLocation})
member.summary: Tear down the specified PackagingUnit(s) within the mentioned setup. Throws an exception in case one or more packaging units could not be torn down.

member.name: M:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Service.ISiplaceSetupCenter.GetReducedActualSetup(System.String)
member.summary: Method delivers the actual physical setup (verified feeders/packaging units on the station tables) filtered by the target setup from SIPLACE Pro. If Setup Center is being used in partial setup mode this data is being filtered by the components of the partial setup. A partial setup includes the components of one or more recipes being selected in Line Control GUI in partial setup mode (Line Controls support the partial setup setting "Off", "Manual recipe selection" or "Automatic selection of downloaded recipe"). In case a component is set-up multiple times, all occurrences are part of this data even if the line does not use all of them.
member.returns: The actual setup of the specified machine.

member.name: M:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Service.ISiplaceSetupCenter.Update(System.Collections.Generic.List{Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.PackagingUnit})
member.summary: Adjust all attributes of the packaging unit. In case of a packaging unit chain all packaging units in the chain will be updated.
member.param: Packaging unit(s), which contain the new values of all packaging unit's properties.
member.returns: The list of successful updated packaging unit(s) (first packaging unit of the splice chain). Otherwise null, if operation was aborted because of a null reference. Packaging units, which couldn't be updated, are not in this list.
member.remarks:
All packaging unit properties can be updated excluding and . The property will be also updated including all properties of the spliced packaging unit.
Online mounted packaging unit cannot be updated. An attempt to update an online mounted packaging unit will through an exception. Offline mounted packaging units can be updated. In case of packaging unit chains the whole chain has to be supplied otherwise the chain will automatically be split!
All errors which occurred during execution can be get with

member.name: M:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Service.ISiplaceSetupCenter.Get(System.Collections.Generic.List{Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.PackagingUnit})
member.summary: Gets the first packaging unit of the splice chain, which contains the corresponding UID.
member.param: The first packaging unit of the splice chain.
member.returns: The list of result of the operation for these packaging units

member.name: M:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Service.ISiplaceSetupCenter.Create(System.Collections.Generic.List{Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.PackagingUnit})
member.summary: Creates new packaging units.
member.remarks:
Check and creates new packaging units in the Setup Center database. This command can be use to import packaging units before the Set or Refill action.
If the packaging unit already exists, the packaging unit won't be created. All errors which occurred during execution can be get with
member.returns: The list of result of the operation for these packaging units

member.name: M:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Service.ISiplaceSetupCenter.Delete(System.Collections.Generic.List{Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.PackagingUnit})
member.summary: Deletes the packaging units with the corresponding UID.
member.remarks: If the packaging unit is in use or mounted to a feeder, the packaging unit won't be deleted. Otherwise the delete operation will be forced, even if the packaging unit is part of a splice chain. In this case, the whole splice chain will be deleted. All errors which occurred during execution can be get with If only a subpart of a packaging unit chain is to be deleted, then use the Update function to split the chain into parts and delete then the packaging units.
member.param: The packaging unit with the corresponding UID
member.returns: The list of result of the operation for these packaging units

member.name: M:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Service.ISiplaceSetupCenter.Activate(System.Collections.Generic.List{Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.ComponentLocation})
member.summary: Activates a deactivated track at the station. If the track is already active at the station, nothing will happen. Throws an exception in case one or more packaging units could not be activated.
member.remarks: This command is not available for all tray feeders.
member.param: The locations which have to be activated.

member.name: M:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Service.ISiplaceSetupCenter.Deactivate(System.Collections.Generic.List{Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.ComponentLocation},System.String)
member.summary: Deactivates an active track at the station. If the track is already deactivated, nothing will happen. Throws and exception in case one or more packaging units could not be deactivated.
member.remarks: This command is not available for all tray feeders and for all stations of platform I and II. The deactivation of a track can be removed by the operator directly at the station (depends from settings) or via Setup Center.
member.param: The locations which have to be deactivated.

member.name: M:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Service.ISiplaceSetupCenter.Lock(System.Collections.Generic.List{Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.PackagingUnit},System.String)
member.summary: Locks material (The unlock is only possible by an external system again). Lock cant be avoided at the station. This functionality is an enhancement of Activate regarding priority. Throws an exception in case one or more packaging units could not be locked.
member.remarks: This command is available for stations released for forced setup verification with Setup Center and in the offline area. The lock is permanent and cannot be removed by an operator at the station or via Setup Center. Only the affected packaging units have to be assigned. If splice chains are assigned, only the first packaging units will be recognized. Spliced packaging units will be ignored. The lock will be persisted and is marked with Reason=0 and Source = 4 in the LockInfo object.
member.param: The packaging units which give the corresponding UID.
A text which give the operator what is the reason of the lock.

member.name: M:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Service.ISiplaceSetupCenter.Unlock(System.Collections.Generic.List{Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.PackagingUnit})
member.summary: Unlocks material, which was locked by an external system before. This functionality is an enhancement of Deactivate regarding priority. Throws an exception in case one or more packaging units could not be unlocked.
member.remarks: This command is only available for stations of platform II+ and Sirio and in the offline area. The lock will be persisted and is marked with Reason=0 and Source = 4 in the LockInfo object.
member.param: The packaging units which give the corresponding UID.

member.name: M:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Service.ISiplaceSetupCenter.SetMessageLevel(System.Int32)
member.summary: Level of detail for messages, sent from Setup Center to client applications. The execution of this remote method changes the setting within Setup Center. Therefore the change of the message level concerns all client applications connected Setup Center.

item.description: Fatal.
Error.
Warn.
Info.
Debug.

member.param: Level of detail for messages from Setup Center.

member.name: M:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Service.ISiplaceSetupCenter.GetDatabaseName
member.summary: Get the database instance name, where the data for this service endpoint is stored. In the deployment of SetupCenter, there can be one database for several service endpoints

member.name: M:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Service.ISiplaceSetupCenter.GetConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets the configuration of this Setup Center instance. It provides line configurations as well as the configured docking stations. The configuration class will contain the following settings:
OnlineVerificationConfiguration: The general settings for online verification of the Setup Center instance like IsSpliceMonitorActive, MissingSpliceThresholdPercent, MissingSpliceThresholdNumberOfItems.
LineConfigurations: For each line the settings for the line like IsFeederSubstitutionAllowed, IsAutomaticReorderActivated, IsRandomFeederSetupForOfflineVerificationAllowed etc. MachineConfigurations: For each station in the line the machine settings like MachineId, MachineName, MachineType, IsMsdVerificationEnabled and ComponentLevelIndicatorThresholds. PrinterConfigurations: For each printer in the line the printer settings like MachineId, PrinterPath, PrinterType.
DockingStationConfiguration: Contains the configuration for docking stations DockingStations: For each configured docking station contains the DockingStationId.

member.name: M:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Service.ISiplaceSetupCenter.FireInstantFeederPlacedEvents(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initiates the InstantFeederPlaced events from SetupCenter by selecting all currently placed feeders in the ActualSetup (online, offline or both depending of given verificationType argument)

member.name: M:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Service.ISiplaceSetupCenter.CheckConnectionState(Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.CheckConnectionStateRequest)
member.summary: Checks the state of the connection.

member.name: M:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Service.ISiplaceSetupCenter.GetPackagingUnitLocation(System.Collections.Generic.List{Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.PackagingUnit})
member.summary: Gets the current packaging unit location. Only works with Setup Center 6.3 and higher.
member.param: The packaging unit with the corresponding UID
member.returns: List of ComponentLocationResult Contains the ComponentLocation if the packaging unit is mounted online or offline. If the packaging unit is not mounted the value is null. The TableState attribute in ComponentLocation indicates whether a packaging unit is online or offline.

member.name: M:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Service.ISiplaceSetupCenter.UpdateSinglePackagingUnit(System.Collections.Generic.List{Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.PackagingUnit})
member.summary: Adjust all attributes of the packaging unit except the ones listed below for online mounted packaging units. Only works with Setup Center 6.3 and higher.
member.remarks: This method allows an update of every packaging unit regardless of the packaging unit status (unmounted, offline or online mounted). If a packaging unit chain is supplied then only the first packaging unit will be updated. The method will update all packaging unit attributes if the packaging unit is not mounted online. If the packaging unit is mounted online then the method will only update the packaging unit attributes not listed in the exception list below. The following attributes of the packaging unit cannot be updated if it is mounted online: [ComponentName], [ComponentBarcode], [ComponentBarcodeFragment], [OriginalQuantity], [Quantity], [GreyZone], [DepletedDate], [LastProductionDate], [BatchId], [Batch2], [BrightnessClass]
member.param: Packaging unit(s) containing the new attribute values.
member.returns: List of PackagingUnitResults: Each PackagingUnitResult contains the updated packaging unit in case of success, otherwise null.

member.name: M:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Service.ISiplaceSetupCenter.GetReducedActualSetups(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: Method delivers the actual physical setups filtered by the target setup for the specified machine(s). Return values only contains setup information for configured and online station(s).
member.returns: The actual setups of the specified machine(s). MachineSetup may be null if machine Id is not found.

member.name: M:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Service.ISiplaceSetupCenter.GetActualSetups(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: Method delivers the actual physical setups *unfiltered* for the specified machine(s). Return values only contains setup information for configured and online station(s). This method only works when used with Setup Center 7.1 or higher!
member.returns: The actual setups of the specified machine(s). MachineSetup may be null if machine Id is not found.

member.name: M:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Service.ISiplaceSetupCenter.GetOfflineSetup(Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.GetOfflineSetupRequest)
member.summary: Method delivers the offline setup for the specified setup path. This method only works when used with Setup Center 9.6 SP2 or higher!
member.param: The path of the setup that is requested.
member.returns: The actual machine setup with the packaging units for the specified setup. May be empty if the setup path is invalid or unknown.

member.name: M:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Service.ISiplaceSetupCenter.ActivateComponentLocations(System.Collections.Generic.List{Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.ComponentLocation})

member.name: M:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Service.ISiplaceSetupCenter.DeactivateComponentLocations(System.Collections.Generic.List{Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.ComponentLocation},System.String)
member.summary: Deactivates an active track at the station. If the track is already deactivated, nothing will happen.
member.remarks: This command is not available for all tray feeders and for all stations of platform I and II. The deactivation of a track can be removed by the operator directly at the station (depends from settings) or via Setup Center.
member.param: The locations which have to be deactivated.

member.name: M:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Service.ISiplaceSetupCenter.LockPackagingUnits(System.Collections.Generic.List{Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.PackagingUnit},System.String)
member.summary: Locks material (The unlock is only possible by an external system again). Lock cant be avoided at the station. This functionality is an enhancement of Activate regarding priority.
member.param: The packaging units which give the corresponding UID.
A text which give the operator what is the reason of the lock.
member.remarks: This command is available for stations released for forced setup verification with Setup Center and in the offline area. The lock is permanent and cannot be removed by an operator at the station or via Setup Center. Only the affected packaging units have to be assigned. If splice chains are assigned, only the first packaging units will be recognized. Spliced packaging units will be ignored. The lock will be persisted and is marked with Reason=0 and Source = 4 in the LockInfo object.

member.name: M:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Service.ISiplaceSetupCenter.UnlockPackagingUnits(System.Collections.Generic.List{Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.PackagingUnit})
member.summary: Unlocks material, which was locked by an external system before. This functionality is an enhancement of Deactivate regarding priority.
member.remarks: This command is only available for stations of platform II+ and Sirio and in the offline area. The lock will be persisted and is marked with Reason=0 and Source = 4 in the LockInfo object.
member.param: The packaging units which give the corresponding UID.

member.name: M:Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Service.ISiplaceSetupCenter.GetPackagingUnitMountLocation(Asm.As.Oib.SiplaceSetupCenter.Contracts.Data.GetPackagingUnitMountLocationRequest)
member.summary: Gets the current packaging unit mount location. Returns a PackagingUnitMountLocation object for each packaging unit. If the packaging unit is mounted online or offline then the ComponentLocation in the PackagingUnitMountLocation is filled. If the packaging unit is only mounted on a feeder then the ComponentLocation in the PackagingUnitMountLocation is null and the FeederLocation in the PackagingUnitMountLocation is filled. If the packaging unit is not mounted at all the OutValue of the result is null.
member.remarks: This method will only deliver results for Setup Center 9.2 or higher!
member.param: The list of packaging units to get the mount location for

If there is no packaging unit mounted on the feeder the PackagingUnitLocation is null.
